segments.text: I can see the woman from where I stand, her focus so intense on that plate she’s drying.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s almost humorous, how she seems utterly oblivious to the flood at her feet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel a pang of anxiety watching the water pour over the sink and drip down the cabinets.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy, with his little hand reaching into the cookie jar, looks so proud of his daring act.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But I’m really just horrified at the sight of that stool, splayed and ready to topple over.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl beside him is so expectant, palm up, waiting for her prize like it’s a game.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: All this while the woman remains in her bubble, unbothered by the chaos that could ensue.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wish I could shake her, tell her to look down, look around, before something drastic happens.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s strange how a moment can be so filled with joy and danger at once.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like a spectator at an accident waiting to happen, dread lurking around the corner.
segments.speaker: PAR
